question.title: If Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between a brokered convention and Democratic Senators' support for Biden.

Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

Resolution criteria for the condition: If more than one ballot is required, this condition is **Yes**; if only one ballot is required, this condition is **No**.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times source shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, this question resolves to **Yes**. Otherwise, it resolves to **No**.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Conditional on both a brokered Democratic convention and 10+ Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out, will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, and (b) at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out.

Given these conditions, will Vivek Ramaswamy be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: 
- (a) Occurs if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting to nominate its candidate.
- (b) Occurs if 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20 as shown by the New York Times interactive.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO otherwise. If the condition is not met, resolves N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024, (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20, and (c) Vivek Ramaswamy is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This occurs if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this does not occur.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20: This occurs if at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out. Otherwise, it does not occur.

(c) Vivek Ramaswamy is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Biden drop out before 7/13?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Given Biden drops out before July 13, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. Then, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Resolution criteria for the condition (P): Biden must drop out or be unable to continue his presidential run before midnight July 13 Central Time for this condition to be true.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): This resolves as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. It resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after the mentioned date.

question.title: Given both Biden drops out before July 13, 2024, and Trump is blocked from the primary ballot under the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13, Central Time, and (b) Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. 

Then, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections?

Resolution criteria:

- For (a) Biden dropping out: This resolves to YES if Biden drops out before this time, otherwise NO.
- For (b) Trump being blocked: This resolves to YES if, on July 15, 2024, Trump is confirmed to be removed or blocked through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. It resolves to NO if these conditions are not met as of that date.
- For the ID political group: This resolves as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. It resolves as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before 7/13, (b) Trump is removed or blocked from the primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by 7/15/2024, and (c) the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13, Central Time. This will resolve to YES if Biden drops out before this time, otherwise NO.

(b) Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024. This will resolve to YES if, on July 15, 2024, Trump is confirmed to be removed or blocked through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. It will resolve to NO if these conditions are not met as of that date. Note: The question pertains strictly to Trump's status as of July 15, 2024, and does not account for legal battles, appeals, or reversals after this date.

(c) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This will resolve as YES if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as NO for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, this will resolve as YES.

This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Conditional on the ID political group holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Linda Yaccarino be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the relationship between two events:

1. **Condition (P):** The ID political group holding the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

2. **Outcome (Q):** Linda Yaccarino being the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024. This will resolve as **Yes** if Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources.

Suppose the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections. Then, will Linda Yaccarino be the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024?

question.title: Given both the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections and Linda Yaccarino is the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, will the BSE SENSEX close between 75k and 76k on July 21, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for seats, this condition will still resolve as **Yes**. (b) Linda Yaccarino is the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. Given these conditions, will the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000, according to Yahoo Finance?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections; (2) Linda Yaccarino is the CEO of Twitter on July 1, 2024; (3) on July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is greater than 75k and less than or equal to 76k?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for seats, this condition will still resolve as **Yes**. (2) Linda Yaccarino is in the position of CEO at Twitter on July 1, 2024, according to official announcements from Twitter or credible media sources. (3) The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, is greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 76,000, according to Yahoo Finance. If all conditions are satisfied, the answer is **Yes**; otherwise, it is **No**.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

question.title: Conditional on Democrats having a brokered convention in 2024, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Then, will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?

Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

Resolution criteria: This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Given a brokered Democratic convention and opposition to early Biden nomination, will Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, and (b) At least 20 House or Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, based on a draft letter circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman and reported by Politico before the end of Sunday, July 21st. Then, will Francis Suarez be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention, otherwise No.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 and at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, and (2) Francis Suarez be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) Democrats will have a brokered convention in 2024 if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Additionally, at least 20 House or Senate Democrats will sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early if, before the end of Sunday, July 21st, a public letter is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures also meet this condition. This is based on a draft letter circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman and reported by Politico.

(2) Francis Suarez will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election if he is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee. This is determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not by the outcome of the 2024 US election day.

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

question.title: Conditional on the New York Knicks winning the 2024 NBA Finals, will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals, being crowned the champion according to the NBA. Given this, will the United States Olympic Team be the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The New York Knicks must be crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals. Resolves No for all other outcomes.
Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves Yes if the United States is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. Resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place before 2027. Resolves No if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

question.title: Given that the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals and the USA tops the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) The New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/), meaning they must not be eliminated from contention and must win the finals. (2) The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. This means the US team must have the highest number of Gold Medals, with ties broken by Silver and then Bronze Medals, as per the official medal table ranking system. 

Then, will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics? This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) The New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals, (2) The USA tops the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024, and (3) The same nation wins more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) The New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/), meaning they must not be eliminated from contention and must win the finals. (2) The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. This means the US team must have the highest number of Gold Medals, with ties broken by Silver and then Bronze Medals, as per the official medal table ranking system. (3) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the following women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This means that at least one NOC must have won gold in two or more of these events. The question resolves as **No** if any of these conditions fail to occur. Note: The question will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

question.title: If Kamala Harris is President by Friday, will Trump's lead over Biden be between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. This will be determined by official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? This will be evaluated based on the 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

question.title: Given Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, and Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 points on July 15, 2024, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points on July 15, 2024. 

Criterion for (a): Kamala Harris will be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source will be official information from the US government or a consensus of credible reporting.

Criterion for (b): Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average is to be checked on the chart for July 15, 2024, as accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

Then, will there be an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan in 2024 before June 6? 

Resolution criteria for the conflict: Resolves Yes if, before June 6, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Kamala Harris becomes President or Acting President by July 26, 2024, and Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, and (b) Before June 6, 2024, there is an armed forces conflict death between China and Taiwan?
question.body:
(a) Kamala Harris will be formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 points as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before June 6th, 2024, credible reports confirm one or more deaths among the armed forces of China or Taiwan as a result of armed conflict between the two parties.

question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Conditional on the US Core CPI increasing by more than 0.1% in July, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, based on the exact (not rounded) value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL.

Then is it true that Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden, according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election, will be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024? This will be determined by the value reported on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, where a positive value indicates a Trump lead and a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

question.title: Given both (a) US Core CPI increases by more than 0.1% in July 2024 and (b) Trump's lead over Biden is between 2 and 3 on July 15, 2024, will Israel expand its ground invasion to Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following two conditions are true:

(a) The seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

Then, will Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024? This question will resolve **Yes** if the [Institute for the Study of War](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/2e746151991643e39e64780f0674f7dd) (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah (the specific locations are shown in the map embedded below) before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024, (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (c) Israel expand its ground invasion to the city of Rafah before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

(b) Resolves YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.

(c) Resolves YES if the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) reports Israeli military operations on its map at any of six locations surrounding Rafah before June 1, 2024.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Given Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump testifies at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, as reported by credible sources. Then, will Israel carry out an attack attributed to them within Iran's borders that leads to the death of at least five individuals, as reported by credible sources, before May 1, 2024?

question.title: Given both Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial and Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (a) credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, and (b) credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel, occurring within Iran's borders, has led to the death of at least five individuals between the date of this question's publication and May 1, 2024. Then, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

Note: The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Will all of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (a) Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial (b) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran (c) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** only if all of the following conditions are met: (a) Credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels, before May 1, 2024; (b) Credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel, occurring within Iran's borders, has led to the death of at least five individuals, between the date of this question's publication and May 1, 2024; and (c) The Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Conditional on a terrorist act occurring in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, will the EU announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: A terrorist attack occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, injuring and/or killing at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). An event is considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

Then, will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024? This resolves as Yes if credible sources report that the EU has announced new tariffs or duties on Chinese electric vehicles into the EU before July 5, 2024. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given both a terrorist act in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics and EU tariffs on Chinese EVs, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, which injures or kills at least one person (other than the terrorist(s)) between July 26 and August 11, 2024, and is described as a 'terrorist attack' by an official French source. (2) The European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, as reported by credible sources.

Then, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election, thus having a brokered convention? The question resolves as **Yes** if more than one round of voting is required, and **No** if only one ballot is needed.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics, (2) The European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, and (3) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(1) A terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics: The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

(2) The European Union announces new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024: This question will resolve as Yes if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(3) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This question resolves as Yes if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as No.

question.title: Will the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack before July 1, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

question.title: Given the Crimean Bridge is attacked before July 1, 2024, will Biden drop out before July 13, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Crimean Bridge is hit with an attack before July 1, 2024. This will resolve as **Yes** if, after May 2, 2024, and before the listed date, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.

Then, is the following true: Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. If this occurs, the market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: If both the Crimean Bridge is attacked and Biden drops out before July 2024, will Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if all of the following are true:
1. After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge.
2. Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13, 2024, Central Time.
3. Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

If any of the first two conditions are not met, the resolution is N/A. If the first two conditions are met, but Asa Hutchinson is not selected as the nominee, the resolution is **No**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, the Crimean Bridge be hit with an attack, (b) Biden drop out before July 13, 2024, and (c) Asa Hutchinson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met: (1) After May 2, 2024, and before July 1, 2024, credible sources report that the Crimean Bridge has been struck with weapons fire, explosives, or projectiles that could pose a credible threat to the integrity of the bridge. (2) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13, 2024, Central Time. (3) Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any of these conditions is not met, this question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Iceland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Iceland qualifies for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Poland also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. 

Then, will Poland participate in a Semi-final and be officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final? If Poland does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given both Iceland and Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024, will Georgia also qualify?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both Iceland and Poland participate in a Semi-final and are officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Then, will Georgia also qualify for the Grand Final? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: The question resolves as **Yes** if both Iceland and Poland qualify for the Grand Final. If either does not qualify, the condition is not met.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the EBU as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, it resolves as **No**.

question.title: Will Iceland, Poland, and Georgia all qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following occur: (a) Iceland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, (b) Poland participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, and (c) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If any of Iceland, Poland, or Georgia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Given ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, will Russia control Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment, and at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, even if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

Then, is it true that Russia will have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024? This resolves as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the ISW map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E under categories indicating Russian control, such as "Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine," "Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours," "Assessed Russian Control," "Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine," or any other categories indicating Russian control. It resolves as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any categories indicating Russian control, including "Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours," "Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives," "Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare," or any other categories indicating Ukrainian control or lack of Russian control.

question.title: Conditional on both ChatGPT being available in the EU and Russia controlling Chasiv Yar, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, meaning that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN, possibly requiring payment, and that it is available to at least >50% of the population. This includes possible restrictions to certain countries or demographics, but the service remains substantially the same as OpenAI's general web interface for interacting with GPT models.

(b) On June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any category indicating Russian control, such as Assessed Russian Control or Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine.

Then, will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? This resolves as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) ChatGPT be generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, (b) Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024, and (c) the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) The question resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories: Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine, Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Assessed Russian Control, Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location. The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to: Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours, Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives, Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare, or any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location.

(c) This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Conditional on a group of at least 5 named Democratic House Members or US Senators pressuring Biden to drop out before July 20th, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Given that both (1) at least 5 named Democratic House Members or Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024, and (2) Nvidia's market cap is larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are true:

(1) At least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this criterion unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before the end date.

(2) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is larger than Apple's, as determined by checking Companies Market Cap at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC) on that day.

Then, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? This will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023. If both conditions are not met, the question resolves N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) At least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th, 2024, (2) Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's on July 17, 2024, and (3) the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body:
(1) At least 5 named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators must work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th, 2024 (Pacific Time). This could be by signing a letter or in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this criterion unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before the end date. If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this part resolves NO.

(2) On July 17, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization must be larger than Apple's. This is determined by checking Companies Market Cap at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC) on that day.

(3) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) must be higher on July 20, 2024, compared to its value on July 20, 2023. This will be verified based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Conditional on the EU announcing new tariffs on Chinese EVs, will Donald Trump be removed from a primary ballot under the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU. Then, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The EU must announce new tariffs or duties on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, as reported by credible sources.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Donald Trump must be officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024. This must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. The question resolves as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

question.title: If the EU imposes new tariffs on Chinese EVs and Trump is blocked from a ballot, will Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: 

1. Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed on imports of Chinese electric vehicles.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

Then, will Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections? 

Resolution criteria:
- The EU tariffs must be announced before July 5, 2024, with credible sources confirming.
- Trump must be removed or blocked from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office by July 15, 2024, with official confirmation.
- Renew must hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, with ties resolved by official statements or credible media reports.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) The European Union announce new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024, (2) Donald Trump be blocked from any U.S. state primary ballot for federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, and (3) Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if all of the following conditions are met:

1. Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

2. On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

3. Renew holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This condition will resolve as **Yes** if Renew holds the most seats and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, this resolution will consider the outcome based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Will ECR hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

question.title: Given ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will Renew also hold the most seats?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: ECR holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This question will resolve as **Yes** if Renew also holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, meaning Renew and ECR are tied for the most seats, and as **No** for all other outcomes. Resolution is based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Given both ECR and Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections, will GUE/NGL hold the most seats as well?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both ECR and Renew hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections. This includes scenarios where ECR and Renew are tied for the most seats. The resolution will be based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

Then, is it also true that GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections? This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**. The resolution will be based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Will both of the following occur after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections: (a) ECR and Renew hold the most seats, (b) GUE/NGL holds the most seats?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met after the 2024 European Parliament elections: (a) ECR and Renew hold the most seats, including scenarios where they are tied for the most seats, and (b) GUE/NGL holds the most seats, including scenarios where they are tied for the most seats. The resolution will be based on official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

question.title: Will Mayor Wilson show at the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29th, 2024?
question.body:
Resolves to yes if Mayor Kurt Wilson is physically at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024.If he dials in on zoom, it will resolve to yes, but we need confirmation it's him (e.g., camera on, him speaking and identifying himself).

 Resolves to no if he isn't there. 

https://roswellcityga.iqm2.com/Citizens/Detail_Meeting.aspx?ID=3278

question.title: Conditional on Mayor Wilson attending the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29th, 2024, will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Mayor Kurt Wilson is physically present or confirmed via Zoom at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024. Then, we want to know if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Mayor Kurt Wilson is physically present or confirmed via Zoom (with camera on and identification) at the meeting. Resolves NO if he is not present.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Trump's lead over Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on the specified date according to 538's national polling average. Resolves NO otherwise. If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given both Mayor Wilson attends the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29, 2024, and Trump's lead over Biden is between 3 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, will the US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Mayor Kurt Wilson is physically present or confirmed via Zoom at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024, and (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average.

Given these conditions, will the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024?

Resolution criteria:
- For condition (a): Resolves YES if Mayor Wilson is confirmed present at the meeting, either physically or via Zoom with confirmation. Resolves NO otherwise.
- For condition (b): Resolves YES if Trump's lead is between 3 and 4 points inclusive on the specified date. Resolves NO otherwise.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if the Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024 using the exact values from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Mayor Wilson will show at the Roswell City Council Open Forum on July 29th, 2024, (b) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, and (c) the Month-over-Month US Core CPI will increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024?
question.body:
(a) Mayor Wilson will show at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024. This resolves to yes if Mayor Kurt Wilson is physically at the Roswell City Council Meeting on July 29th, 2024. If he dials in on Zoom, it will resolve to yes, but we need confirmation it's him (e.g., camera on, him speaking and identifying himself). Resolves to no if he isn't there. More details at: https://roswellcityga.iqm2.com/Citizens/Detail_Meeting.aspx?ID=3278

(b) Trump's lead over Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average. This resolves based on Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, a reported value of Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden would be a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

(c) The Month-over-Month US Core CPI will increase by more than 0.1% in July 2024. Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024. The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

question.title: Will the Venezuelan electoral commission publish full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as Yes if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities).

question.title: Given the Venezuelan electoral commission publishes full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024, will the closing value of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, be greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k?
question.body:
This question resolves as Yes if, before Monday, August 12, 2024, at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), credible sources report that any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities). 

Additionally, the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, must be greater than 76,000 and less than or equal to 77,000, according to Yahoo Finance. If both conditions are met, the question resolves as Yes. If the first condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given both the Venezuelan electoral results are published before August 12, 2024, and BSE SENSEX is between 76k and 77k on July 21, 2024, will Biden remain President through July 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (1) Before August 12, 2024, the Venezuelan government publishes full results of the July 28, 2024 presidential election, disaggregated to the level of parish, and (2) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k. Then, will Biden remain US President through the end of July 2024? Resolves YES if Biden remains President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment does not cause a YES resolution.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) The Venezuelan electoral commission publishes full results of the July 28 presidential election before August 12, 2024, (2) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is greater than 76k and less than or equal to 77k, and (3) Biden remains President through end of July 2024?
question.body: (1) This question resolves as Yes if credible sources report that, before Monday, August 12, 2024 at 12:01 AM Venezuelan Standard Time (VET), any entity of the Venezuelan government has published results of the July 28, 2024 election purporting to represent 100% of the votes cast, disaggregated to the level of parish (*parroquia*, a subdivision of municipalities). (2) This question resolves as the closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance. (3) Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, given Kamala's odds increase next week?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris's Electoral College probability in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. Then, is it true that Joe Biden will have an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024?

Resolution criteria for Kamala's odds: Resolves YES if Harris's Electoral College probability >46.6% on the specified date and time in Nate Silver's model. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for Biden's interview: Resolves YES if Biden appears in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, etc., but can include appearances on podcasts or shows like 60 Minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed. Resolves NO if no qualifying interview is released before the deadline.

question.title: Given Kamala's odds of winning increase and Biden has an in-person interview, will 20 Democrats oppose early Biden nomination?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) Kamala Harris's odds of winning the Electoral College increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model, specifically, her probability is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. (b) Joe Biden has an in-person interview or conversation on camera for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This interview does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls, but can include podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person.

Then, will at least 20 House or Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early? This resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model (b) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024 (c) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) Resolves YES if Biden appears in an in-person interview for at least 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, or town halls, but can include podcasts, late night shows, or shows like 60 minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person. Resolves NO if no such interview is released before market close at the end of July.

(c) This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will the head of the Secret Service resign within the next 90 days?
question.body: Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?

question.title: If the head of the Secret Service resigns within the next 90 days, will Doug Burgum be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason no longer serves as the director before October 12, 2024. Then, will Doug Burgum be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This question will resolve as **Yes** if Doug Burgum is selected as the nominee. It is not restricted to the current candidates; other options may be added in the future. The resolution is determined solely by the selection of the delegates at the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Given both the Secret Service director resigns and Doug Burgum is the GOP nominee, will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following two conditions are met: (a) Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resigns, is fired, or for any other reason is no longer the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024; and (b) Doug Burgum is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Then, will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? This resolves as **Yes** if more than one ballot is required, and **No** otherwise.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The head of the Secret Service resigns within the next 90 days (b) Doug Burgum is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (c) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) Will Kimberly Cheatle, the Director of the U.S. Secret Service, resign, be fired, or for any other reason no longer be the director of the Secret Service before October 12, 2024?
(b) Will Doug Burgum be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? This resolves as Yes if he is selected by the delegates, regardless of who is the nominee on the election day.
(c) Will the Democratic Party require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election? This resolves as Yes if more than one ballot is required.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: Given Joe Biden announces dropping out and resigning, will there be diplomatic expulsions or recalls between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements occur before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time. Then, is it true that before June 1, 2024, one of the following events occurs according to official statements or credible reports:

- The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC).
- The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
- The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
- The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines?

If there are no such reports before that date, then the outcome resolves as **No**.

question.title: Given both Biden's resignation announcement and diplomatic tensions between the Philippines and China, will Israel attack Iran?
question.body:
Suppose the following two events occur: 

1. Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this part as YES. Otherwise, this part resolves NO on August 1st.

2. Before June 1, 2024, one of these four events happens, according to official statements or credible reports: 
   - The Philippines expels at least one diplomat representing the People's Republic of China (PRC). 
   - The Philippines recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the PRC.
   - The PRC expels at least one diplomat representing the Philippines.
   - The PRC recalls at least one of its diplomats stationed in the Philippines. 

If there are no such reports before that date, then this part resolves as NO.

Given these two events occur, will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024? This question resolves YES if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Joe Biden announces he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July 2024, (2) Diplomatic expulsions or recalls take place between the Philippines and China before June 1, 2024, and (3) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(1) Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements must be made before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July.
